Title: How To Accomplish Greatness ï½œ Tao Te Ching Chapter 45 Explained

Content.Knowledge Point: The greatest work is done anonymously and without need for recognition.
Content.Text: Great accomplishment seems imperfect, yet it does not outlive its usefulness. Great fullness seems empty, yet cannot be exhausted. Great straightness seems twisted. Great intelligence seems stupid. Great eloquence seems awkward.

Content.Knowledge Point: True mastery is not flashy or pretentious, but rather the result of years of dedication to the task's fundamentals.
Content.Text: Movement overcomes cold. Stillness overcomes heat. Stillness and tranquility set things in order in the universe. As I read this chapter, the second line about great accomplishment being outlasted by its usefulness really got me thinking about the motivations we have for our work.

Content.Knowledge Point: Balance is achieved through a blend of tranquil inaction and action taken with trust in the universe.
